name: places/ChIJCSUe6Cb2wokRBlGhC_OFo8Y
formattedAddress: 792 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 792 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025-5150, USA

originalText.text: I love the PWV staff and living environment it’s so difficult to find dog friendly apartments and this truly is one. The dog run is very accessible and great for the animals. Whenever I call for maintenance Kim always picks up the phone with a positive attitude and the maintenance staff is very helpful and they come within a reasonable amount of time. They also offer for the staff to come when you aren’t home which may seem uneasy for some but after some time here I know the staff is incredibly reliable and trustworthy.The Terraces are beautiful and a great addition if you can get an apartment with one I use mine everyday and even have a small garden out there.- jessina w

originalText.text: they are on purposely holding your deposit. Finding all kinds of excuse like (our accountant is away, I mailed out your check but you are not at home) especially Hilda. It is targeted at international students who have no time to struggle with them. Hilda is the worst, she a dead meat doesn’t fear of anything.

originalText.text:
I lived here for a year and the place itself was fine. We moved in to a unit with water damages that we weren’t told about, so they had to completely change the flooring while we were there. It was definitely a headache, but they did compensate us for it without much debate, so I’d say in terms of NYC landlords, they’re definitely one of the better ones. The gyms in the building are dark and musty, but it is free, so can’t complain too much.

I’m giving 3 stars mainly because moving in and out is possibly one of the worst experiences you’ll ever have. You have to move things in from the back of the building down a flight of stairs into the basement, walk what feels like a mile to the elevators and then up to your apartment. The back entrance that you have to use also isn’t close to anywhere you can park your car or truck, so every time you bring something, you have to walk around the entire building.

Aside from those few issues, I’d say it’s a fine building, in a great location with some very friendly doormen/women.

originalText.text: This place is very nice. The management are wonderful and respectful. Very clean building well maintained, nice view. Nice people. Loved it.

text.text: This place is very nice. The management are wonderful and respectful. Very clean building well maintained, nice view. Nice people. Loved it.

originalText.text: We rented one of the renovated so-called 1 bedroom apartments (upper west-side $ market prices) with the promise that building upgrades and renovations would be completed within a few months.  9 months later and there is no sign that corridor rugs will be replaced, elevator doors cleaned and/or upgraded, etc.  Additionally, the building maintenance is very poor.  As concerns the front desk security, there is none. People come and go without person at the front desk asking where people are going, or calling up to the apartment to ask if we're expecting someone.  This is not a secure building or safe situation.  It gets even worst: My niece was visiting with us and left the key in the apartment in error. I was not home, so I told here to go to front desk for them to call me so that I could authorize the front desk to give her the spare key.  The person covering the entrance gave her the key without asking  her for ID, or having her sign the key out,  OR giving me a call to authorize her entry. THIS IS NOT A PLACE YOU WANT TO LIVE IN OR PAY HIGH RENT FOR. Poorly managed and maintained.
